intro: Microcarpaea montevidensis, commonly known as the Montevidensis microcarpaea, is a flowering plant native to South America, specifically Uruguay and parts of Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
